Have you ever wanted to turn off "Show Previews" for all notifications instead of just for Messages? If so, this patch is for you...
Allows you to set a custom message/text (or remove all text) for all notifications thereby giving you the ability to protect your privacy for third party app notifications. By default, I removed all text except for the preview text which currently displays "New Notification" but you can delete units to show stock text (i.e. the contact/phone # etc) or set a custom text of your choosing.
Customizes the following text...
- Primary Text: (Contact/Sender/Phone # etc) - Primary Subtitle Text - Secondary Text: (Preview/Body/iMessage Text etc) - Hint Text: (Slide for more/Unlock for more etc)
[v.1] Tested with an iPad mini 4 on 10.2. Made as a request via e-mail. (10-28-17)

Primary Subtitle Text: (Default=No Text, Set Custom Text=Override Type:NSString or Stock Text=D)
Secondary Text (Preview/Body/iMessage Text etc): (Default="New Notification" Text, Set Custom Text=Override Type:NSString or Stock Text=D)
